metadata.Title: CVE-2022-32816 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The issue was addressed with improved UI handling. This issue is fixed in watchOS 8.7, tvOS 15.6, iOS 15.6 and iPadOS 15.6, macOS Monterey 12.5. Visiting a website that frames malicious content may lead to UI spoofing.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32816` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.36.6-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.36.6-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.36.6-1
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.36.6-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.36.6-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.36.6-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.36.6-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.36.6-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.36.6-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.36.6-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.36.6-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.36.6-1
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.36.6-1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.36.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.36.6-1').
